"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559329c66368723762000e0e#post_559329c66368723762000e0e
Okay, we're not going to see any Iron Man suits within this century anytime soon. 
Understandable, because powered armor is still a highly experimental vision at this point.

_But what about time periods like the 22nd century and beyond?_
Technology by then probably would allow for such things to be possible, yes?

Why don't you steal a tank and start firing it inside a city?  I'm sure that would prove to the police you're a hero!

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55932b8f63687233af0006fb#post_55932b8f63687233af0006fb
Seriously tho. Stands in general in the real world. How would they fare?

They're ghostly figures that manifest close to their users.

Generally only one stand per user. (Though It's possible for them to have different stages I.E Echoes)

The damage in the stand is reflected in the user.

Stands can only be seen by other Stand users. (The exceptions being ones tied to physical objects, Like Strength)

They become weaker the farther away from the user they are. (Long range stands exist, But they're simpler)

They're usually bound to the user's body. (Exceptions include strength and the fool)

They serve their User without question. (Though some can act autonomously if It's for the purpose of saving their master)

And they each have a unique ability.

Also, They're a reflection of the user's fighting spirits.

Edit: Some can hurt their own users though. (Like Superfly and Cheap trick)
